p: After 7 days of continuous culture of parasites in the presence of herbal extracts, none of the concentrations of P. longifolia or M. oleifera tested were able to clear 100% of the infecting parasites ( Figure 1). Combined with the fact they exhibited an activity against the malaria parasite in the â€˜inactive' range suggest that aqueous extracts of these two herbs do not work independently as effective antimalarial agents.
